issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: relate to the problem discussed in YARN-1857. But the min method is flawed when we are using DRC. Have run into a real scenario in production where queueCapacity: <memory:1056256, vCores:3750>, qconsumed: <memory:1054720, vCores:361>, consumed: <memory:125952, vCores:170> limit: <memory:214016, vCores:755>.  headRoom calculation returns 88064 where there is only 1536 left in the queue because DRC effectively compare by vcores. It then caused deadlock because RMcontainer allocator thought there is still space for mapper and won't preempt a reducer in a full queue to schedule a mapper. Propose fix with componentwiseMin.
fields.summary: Capacity Scheduler headroom for DRF is wrong

bq. // app 1 ask for 10GB memory and 1 vcore,
To
bq. // allocates 10GB memory and 1 vcore to app 1.

Same to app2.
Thanks [~leftnoteasy] for review! Updated the test comment
